meanings.definition: One of two identical strands into which a chromosome splits during cell division.
meanings.sent1: During cell division, chromatids separate to form new cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study chromatids to understand how cells reproduce.
meanings.sent3: The chromatids decided to split up and create more chromosomes for the party.
meanings.sent4: The chromatids danced apart like two partners in a synchronized routine.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the chromatids looked like tiny, colorful threads.

meanings.definition: A threadlike strand of DNA in the nucleus of a cell.
meanings.sent1: The chromatids contain important genetic information within the cell.
meanings.sent2: DNA is organized into chromatids to maintain cell function.
meanings.sent3: The chromatids in the nucleus were having a DNA party.
meanings.sent4: The chromatids intertwined like a complex puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained how the chromatids carry the genetic code of an organism.
